title: R for Data Science
author: Garrett Grolemund, Hadley Wickham
description: This book will teach you how to do data science with R

title: Hands-On Programming with R
author: Garrett Grolemund
description: This book will teach you how to program in R, with hands-on examples.

title: R Graphics Cookbook
author: Winston Chang
description: A practical guide that provides more than 150 recipes to help you generate high-quality graphs quickly

title: Modern Dive
author: Chester Ismay, Albert Y. Kim
description: Statistical Inference via Data Science

title: An Introduction to Statistical Learning with Applications in R
author: Gareth James, Daniela Witten, Trevor Hastie, Robert Tibshirani
description: This book provides an introduction to statistical learning methods.

title: Data Visualization A Practical Introduction
author: Kieran Healy
description: An introduction to both the ideas and the methods of data visualization in a sensible, comprehensible, reproducible way.

title: R Markdown: The Definitive Guide
author: Yihui Xie, J. J. Allaire, Garrett Grolemund
description: A definitive guide to the RMarkdown ecosystem

title: R Packages
author: Hadley Wickham
description: Learn how to turn your code into packages that others can easily download and use.

title: Happy Git and GitHub for the useR
author: Jennifer Bryan
description: Instructions on how to install and integrate Git and GitHub into your daily work with R

title: blogdown: Creating Websites with R Markdown
author: Yihui Xie, Amber Thomas, Alison Presmanes Hill
description: Instructions on how to create websites using R Markdown and Hugo

title: Advanced R
author: Hadley Wickham
description: The book is designed primarily for R users who want to improve their programming skills and understanding of the language.

title: Forecasting: Principles and Practice
author: Rob J Hyndman, George Athanasopoulos
description: A comprehensive introduction to forecasting methods

title: Practical R for Mass Communication and Journalism
author: Sharon Machlis
description: Ideas, tools, and techniques for incorporating data and visualizations into your narratives.

title: Text Mining with R
author: Julia Silge, David Robinson
description: Introduction of text mining using the tidytext package and other tidy tools in R.

title: Feature Engineering and Selection: A Practical Approach for Predictive Models
author: Max Kuhn, Kjell Johnson
description: The goal of this book is to help practitioners build better models by focusing on the predictors.

title: bookdown: Authoring Books and Technical Documents with R Markdown
author: Yihui Xie
description: A guide to authoring books and technical documents with R Markdown.

title: 21 Recipes for Mining Twitter Data with rtweet
author: Bob Rudis
description: Provides 21 easily adaptable Twitter mining recipes

title: Interactive web-based data visualization with R, plotly, and shiny
author: Carson Sievert
description: Gain insight and practical skills for creating interactive and dynamic web graphics for data analysis from R

title: Spatial Data Science
author: Edzer Pebesma, Roger Bivand
description: Introduces and explains the concepts underlying spatial data.

title: Efficient R programming
author: Colin Gillespie, Robin Lovelace
description: This book is for anyone who wants to make their R code faster to type, faster to run and more scalable.

title: Fundamentals of Data Visualization
author: Claus O. Wilke
description: A guide to making visualizations that accurately reflect the data, tell a story, and look professional.

title: Geospatial Health Data: Modeling and Visualization with R-INLA and Shiny
author: Paula Moraga
description: Describes spatial and spatio-temporal statistical methods and visualization techniques to analyze georeferenced health data in R.

title: Computational Genomics with R
author: Altuna Akalin
description: The aim of this book is to provide the fundamentals for data analysis for genomics.

title: Broadening Your Statistical Horizons: Generalized Linear Models and Multilevel Models
author: Julie Legler,Paul Roback
description: Intended to be accessible to undergraduate students who have successfully completed a regression course.

title: Introduction to Econometrics with R
author: Christoph Hanck, Martin Arnold, Alexander Gerber, Martin Schmelzer
description: Aims to provide students with a platform-independent e-learning arrangement by seamlessly intertwining theoretical core knowledge and empirical skills in undergraduate econometrics

title: Geocomputation with R
author: Robin Lovelace, Jakub Nowosad, Jannes Muenchow
description: This book is for people who want to analyze, visualize and model geographic data with open source software. The book is designed for intermediate-to-advanced R users interested in geocomputation and R beginners who have prior experience with geographic data.

title: Spatial Data Science
author: Edzer Pebesma, Roger Bivand
description: This book introduces and explains the concepts underlying spatial data: points, lines, polygons, rasters, coverages, geometry attributes, data cubes, reference systems, as well as higher-level concepts including how attributes relate to geometries and how this affects analysis.

title: Mastering Shiny
author: Hadley Wickham
description: This book complements Shinyâ€™s online documentation and is intended to help app authors develop a deeper understanding of Shiny

title: Hands-On Machine Learning with R
author: Bradley Boehmke, Brandon Greenwell
description: This book provides hands-on modules for many of the most common machine learning methods

title: Agile Data Science with R
author: Edwin Thoen
description: A workflow for doing data science in R, using Agile principles

title: ggplot2: Elegant Graphics for Data Analysis
author: Hadley Wickham
description: Master ggplot2 and the rich grammar that underlies it

title: Mastering Spark with R
author: Javier Luraschi, Kevin Kuo, Edgar Ruiz
description: In this book you will learn how to use Apache Spark with R.
